member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS
member.summary: Contains information about an image list draw operation and is used with the function.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.cbSize
member.summary: The size of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.himl
member.summary: A handle to the image list that contains the image to be drawn.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.i
member.summary: The zero-based index of the image to be drawn.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.hdcDst
member.summary: A handle to the destination device context.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.x
member.summary: The x-coordinate that specifies where the image is drawn.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.y
member.summary: The y-coordinate that specifies where the image is drawn.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.cx
member.summary: A value that specifies the number of pixels to draw, relative to the upper-left corner of the drawing operation as specified by xBitmap and yBitmap. If cx and cy are zero, then draws the entire valid section. The method does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.cy
member.summary: A value that specifies the number of pixels to draw, relative to the upper-left corner of the drawing operation as specified by xBitmap and yBitmap. If cx and cy are zero, then draws the entire valid section. The method does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.xBitmap
member.summary: The x-coordinate that specifies the upper-left corner of the drawing operation in reference to the image itself. Pixels of the image that are to the left of xBitmap and above yBitmap do not appear.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.yBitmap
member.summary: The y-coordinate that specifies the upper-left corner of the drawing operation in reference to the image itself. Pixels of the image that are to the left of xBitmap and above yBitmap do not appear.

summary.para: The image background color. This parameter can be an application-defined RGB value or one of the following values.

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
The default background color. The image is drawn using the image list background color.
No background color. The image is drawn transparently.

summary.para: The image foreground color. This member is used only if fStyle includes the ILD_BLEND25 or ILD_BLEND50 flag. This parameter can be an application-defined RGB value or one of the following values:

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
The default foreground color. The image is drawn using the system highlight color as the foreground color.
No blend color. The image is blended with the color of the destination device context.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.fStyle
member.summary: A flag specifying the drawing style and, optionally, the overlay image. See the comments section at the end of this topic for information on the overlay image. This member can contain one or more image list drawing flags.

summary.para: A value specifying a raster operation code. These codes define how the color data for the source rectangle will be combined with the color data for the destination rectangle to achieve the final color. This member is ignored if fStyle does not include the ILD_ROP flag. Some common raster operation codes include:

listheader.description: Value
Meaning
Fills the destination rectangle using the color associated with index zero in the physical palette. (This color is black for the default physical palette.)
Inverts the destination rectangle.
Merges the source rectangle colors with the specified pattern by using the Boolean AND operator.
Merges the inverted source rectangle colors with the destination rectangle colors by using the Boolean OR operator.
Copies the inverted source rectangle to the destination.
Combines the source and destination rectangle colors by using the Boolean OR operator. Inverts the resultant color.
Copies the specified pattern into the destination bitmap.
Combines the specified pattern colors with the destination rectangle colors by using the Boolean XOR operator.
Combines the pattern colors with the inverted source rectangle colors and combines the result with the destination rectangle colors by using the Boolean OR operator.
Combines the source and destination rectangle colors by using the Boolean AND operator.
Copies the source rectangle directly to the destination rectangle.
Combines the destination rectangle's inverted colors with the source rectangle colors by using the Boolean AND operator.
Combines the source and destination rectangle colors by using the Boolean XOR operator.
Combines the source and destination rectangle colors by using the Boolean OR operator.
Fills the destination rectangle using the color associated with index one in the physical palette. This color is white for the default physical palette.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.fState
member.summary: A flag that specifies the drawing state. This member can contain one or more image list state flags. You must use comctl32.dll version 6 to use this member. See the Remarks.

summary.para: Used with the alpha blending effect.
When used with ILS_ALPHA, this member holds the value for the alpha channel. This value can be from 0 to 255, with 0 being completely transparent, and 255 being completely opaque.
You must use comctl32.dll version 6 to use this member. See the Remarks.

member.name: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.crEffect
member.summary: A color used for the glow and shadow effects. You must use comctl32.dll version 6 to use this member. See the Remarks.
